    • How to read the radarcharts of the relative rigor score (RRS)

    Extract RRS Sector Scores for Each Applicant

    Source: R/extractors.R
    extract_sector_scores.Rd

    This function processes a list of applicants, extracting the Relative Rigor Score (RRS) for each sector for each applicant and compiling them into a single data frame. It includes metadata such as ORCID, LastName, and ExternalRaterName from the applicant's profile. The function can return the data in either "long" or "wide" format based on the format parameter. In the long format, each row is one sector score for each applicant and rater. In the wide format, the relative rigor scores (rel_score) are displayed as separate columns for each rater, side-by-side.

    Usage

    extract_sector_scores(applicant_list, format = "long")

    Arguments

    applicant_list

    A list containing the RESQUE jsons from multiple applicants.

    format

    A character string specifying the format of the output data frame. In the long format, each row is one sector score for each applicant and rater. In the wide format, the relative rigor scores (rel_score) are displayed as separate columns for each rater, side-by-side.

    Value

    A data frame containing the RRS sector scores for each applicant. The structure of the returned data frame depends on the format parameter.
